meta.title: Session 04: Email, AI Tools & Office Productivity
meta.description: Covers Gmail advanced features (Scheduling, Signatures), AI writing tools (QuillBot, Grammarly, Gemini), basic MS Word/Excel skills, and Windows system maintenance.

studyTopics.hint: Tools like 'Schedule Send' and 'Signature' save time.
studyTopics.searchQuery: how to schedule email and add signature in Gmail
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Manage email communication professionally using automation and scheduling.

studyTopics.hint: Using AI to fix grammar or rewrite text.
studyTopics.searchQuery: what is QuillBot and Grammarly used for
studyTopics.learningOutcome: leverage AI tools to improve writing quality and efficiency.

studyTopics.hint: Entering data into cells, rows, and columns.
studyTopics.searchQuery: excel basic terms row column cell workbook
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Understand the fundamental structure of spreadsheets for data entry.

studyTopics.hint: Cleaning up junk files to speed up the PC.
studyTopics.searchQuery: what does disk cleanup and defragmenter do
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Perform basic maintenance to keep the computer running smoothly.

studyTopics.hint: Editing, undoing mistakes, and wrapping text.
studyTopics.searchQuery: ms word text wrapping and undo redo guide
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Edit and format documents efficiently using Word or OpenOffice Writer.

questions.question: In Gmail, what feature would you use to write an email now but have it delivered automatically at 9:00 AM tomorrow?
questions.explanation: Schedule Send allows you to pick a specific date and time for your email to be sent.

questions.question: Which AI tool mentioned in the session is primarily known as a 'Paraphrasing Assistant' to help rewrite text?
questions.explanation: QuillBot is an AI tool designed to paraphrase and restructure sentences to improve clarity or change tone.

questions.question: What is the function of 'Disk Cleanup' in Windows?
options: To delete unnecessary temporary files and free up space
questions.explanation: Disk Cleanup scans the drive for temporary and unnecessary files that can be safely deleted to reclaim storage space.

questions.question: In Microsoft Excel or OpenOffice Calc, what is the intersection of a Row and a Column called?
questions.explanation: A Cell is the specific rectangular box where a row and column meet, used to hold data.

questions.question: Which symbol is used in Gmail to tag or address a specific recipient within the body of an email?
questions.explanation: Using the @ symbol followed by a name allows you to mention a specific person in an email.

questions.question: What is 'Google Gemini' described as in this session?
options: A smarter task management and AI partner
questions.explanation: Google Gemini is an advanced AI introduced to assist with smarter task management and information processing.

questions.question: If you make a mistake while typing in MS Word, which command allows you to reverse the last action?
questions.explanation: The Undo command (usually Ctrl+Z) reverses the most recent action taken in the document.

questions.question: What is an 'Email Signature'?
options: Signing your name on the screen with a pen
A block of text (like name and phone number) automatically added to the end of outgoing emails
questions.explanation: An automatic signature saves time by appending your contact details or closing sign-off to every email you send.

questions.question: Which device is an input device used specifically to read product codes in a supermarket?
questions.explanation: A Barcode Reader scans the black and white lines on products to input product data into the computer.

questions.question: What is the main difference between Wi-Fi and a Wired Connection?
options: Wired connections use cables (Ethernet); Wi-Fi is wireless
Wired connections do not need electricity
questions.explanation: Wired connections rely on physical cables (like LAN/Ethernet) connecting the device to the router, while Wi-Fi transmits data via radio waves.

questions.question: In MS Word, what does 'Text Wrapping' allow you to do?
options: Control how text flows around images or objects
Change the color of the text
questions.explanation: Text Wrapping determines how text fits around graphic elements, such as wrapping tightly around a picture or sitting above/below it.

questions.question: Which AI tool helps check your spelling, grammar, and tone as you write?
questions.explanation: Grammarly is an AI writing assistant that reviews spelling, grammar, punctuation, and clarity.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Disk Defragmenter'?
options: To break the disk into pieces
To rearrange files on the hard drive so they are contiguous, improving speed
To change the date and time
questions.explanation: Defragmentation reorganizes scattered data on a hard drive so the computer can read files more efficiently.

questions.question: Which formatting mode in Gmail allows you to use bold, colors, and bullets?
questions.explanation: Rich Text formatting supports styling options like bold, italics, colors, and lists, unlike Plain Text.

questions.question: What is a 'Shortcut' in Windows?
options: A link/icon that points to a file, folder, or program for quick access
questions.explanation: A shortcut is a small file that points to the actual location of a program or document, allowing you to open it from the desktop.

questions.question: Which of the following software is best suited for creating a digital spreadsheet?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Excel (and OpenOffice Calc) is designed specifically for creating and managing spreadsheets.

questions.question: When entering data in Excel, what happens if the text is too long for the cell?
options: It may spill over or appear cut off unless you adjust the Column Width
It automatically deletes the extra text
questions.explanation: If data exceeds the cell width, you usually need to widen the column or use 'Wrap Text' to make it visible.

questions.question: What is the primary role of a Data Entry Operator?
options: To input data from various sources into a computer system accurately
questions.explanation: Data Entry Operators are responsible for entering, updating, and maintaining data in computer systems.

questions.question: Which of the following is a 'Flash Memory' storage device?
questions.explanation: USB drives use flash memory to store data portably.

questions.question: If your computer shows the wrong date or time, where can you fix it?
questions.explanation: Date and Time settings in the Control Panel or Settings app allow you to manually correct the system clock.
